answers.author: Robert Carty
answers.text:
Two files they may find useful are the Model Internship Guidelines and Internship Toolkit:
http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/career_resources/model_internship_guidelines
http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/career_resources/internship_toolkit
While a little old, both documents are undergoing review and consolidation this  year by an ICMA Task Force.
There are additional resources such as the Local Government Management Internship: http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/career_development/lgmi
There are some articles and examples in this compilation also, though it covers the entire next generation gamut:
http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/career_resources/news_reports_presentations/pm_nextgen

answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
If the member is in a town/city with a university, I would suggest starting there.  Here in Charlottesville, UVA has a ver formal internship program in place already - and they place undergrads in various work places around the community either for a summer or an entire academic year.  All I do is complete an internship description and then interview the intern who's placed with our office.  So, that would be a great place to start.  Good luck!
